# -*- coding: utf-8 -

# pylint: disable=no-else-continue

import os
import os.path
import re
import sys
import threading
import time



[docs]
COMPILED_EXT_RE = re.compile(r"py[co]$")






[docs]
class Reloader(threading.Thread):
    def __init__(self, extra_files=None, interval=1, callback=None):
        super().__init__()


[docs]
        self.daemon = True


        self._extra_files = set(extra_files or ())
        self._interval = interval
        self._callback = callback



[docs]
    def add_extra_file(self, filename):
        self._extra_files.add(filename)





[docs]
    def get_files(self):
        fnames = [
            COMPILED_EXT_RE.sub("py", module.__file__)
            for module in tuple(sys.modules.values())
            if getattr(module, "__file__", None)
        ]

        fnames.extend(self._extra_files)

        return fnames





[docs]
    def run(self):
        mtimes = {}
        while True:
            for filename in self.get_files():
                try:
                    mtime = os.stat(filename).st_mtime
                except OSError:
                    continue
                old_time = mtimes.get(filename)
                if old_time is None:
                    mtimes[filename] = mtime
                    continue
                elif mtime > old_time:
                    if self._callback:
                        self._callback(filename)
            time.sleep(self._interval)






has_inotify = False
if sys.platform.startswith("linux"):
    try:
        import inotify.constants
        from inotify.adapters import Inotify



[docs]
        has_inotify = True


    except ImportError:
        pass


if has_inotify:



[docs]
    class InotifyReloader(threading.Thread):


[docs]
        event_mask = (
            inotify.constants.IN_CREATE
            | inotify.constants.IN_DELETE
            | inotify.constants.IN_DELETE_SELF
            | inotify.constants.IN_MODIFY
            | inotify.constants.IN_MOVE_SELF
            | inotify.constants.IN_MOVED_FROM
            | inotify.constants.IN_MOVED_TO
        )



        def __init__(self, extra_files=None, callback=None):
            super().__init__()


[docs]
            self.daemon = True


            self._callback = callback
            self._dirs = set()
            self._watcher = Inotify()

            for extra_file in extra_files:
                self.add_extra_file(extra_file)



[docs]
        def add_extra_file(self, filename):
            dirname = os.path.dirname(filename)

            if dirname in self._dirs:
                return

            self._watcher.add_watch(dirname, mask=self.event_mask)
            self._dirs.add(dirname)





[docs]
        def get_dirs(self):
            fnames = [
                os.path.dirname(
                    os.path.abspath(COMPILED_EXT_RE.sub("py", module.__file__))
                )
                for module in tuple(sys.modules.values())
                if getattr(module, "__file__", None)
            ]

            return set(fnames)





[docs]
        def run(self):
            self._dirs = self.get_dirs()

            for dirname in self._dirs:
                if os.path.isdir(dirname):
                    self._watcher.add_watch(dirname, mask=self.event_mask)

            for event in self._watcher.event_gen():
                if event is None:
                    continue

                filename = event[3]

                self._callback(filename)





else:

    class InotifyReloader(object):
        def __init__(self, extra_files=None, callback=None):
            raise ImportError(
                "You must have the inotify module installed to "
                "use the inotify reloader"
            )




[docs]
preferred_reloader = InotifyReloader if has_inotify else Reloader





[docs]
reloader_engines = {
    "auto": preferred_reloader,
    "poll": Reloader,
    "inotify": InotifyReloader,
}
